newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico stocks end roller coaster day higher.
newsitem.headline: Mexico stocks end roller coaster day higher.

text.p: Mexican stocks ended a roller-coaster session on Thursday higher as foreign investors hunted for cheap stocks, dealers said.
The IPC index of 37 leading shares ended up 67.16 points to 4,464.98. Volume was healthy at 120.10 million shares.
"Foreign investors have been buying, but the purchases are very selective," said one dealer.
Rumours, later denied, that Standard and Poors rating agency was set to upgrade its rating on Mexico's sovereign debt sent stocks quickly higher at midday.
Stocks pared their gains after the rating agency denied it was considering such a move.
"After the S&P business, prices came back down, but investors must have seen some attractive prices because buy orders hit the market soon after," another dealer said.
Gainers beat decliners 75 to 21 on the broader market.

Bucking the market was mining company Grupo Mexico, down 1.95 pesos to 24.05 pesos in its L shares. U.S. mining giant Asarco Inc. said it sold 20 million L series shares as part of its buyback programme.
Market heavyweight Telmex L shares rose 32 centavos to 19.30 pesos.
Dealers said some investors appeared to be betting there would be no political or economic fallout from upcoming mid-term elections on July 6.
